text: Exploiting Weakness, Yuan Shao Makes a Claim for The North

The Governor of Ji, Han Fu, has found himself in a precarious position. As the Coalition falls apart around him, he considers himself trapped on a precipice, with strong and powerful rivals all around him, eager to take his bountiful land for themselves. Several of his advisors and friends, including Gao Gan, warn him of Gongsun Zan's ambitions and suggest an invasion is inevitable. Thanks to the counsel of these advisors that he considers friends, Han Fu is convinced that he alone cannot possibly stand against Gongsun Zan. Thus, with a touch of timidity and naivety,  he agrees to submit to Yuan Shao, trusting that their combined efforts are enough to safeguard the province. Of course, this was all a cunning scheme by Yuan Shao, and Han Fu's independence is the last thing on his mind as he absorbs the former Governor's armies into his own...
Making His Ambitions Known, The White Horse General Rides Out

Gongsun Zan was for many years a trusted general of Liu Yu, and together they acted as sword and brush alike when dealing with the frontier tribes. Over time, however, tensions have begun to rise between the two. Liu Yu, fearing that Gongsun Zan's ambitions may swell too much, raises troops and attempts to curb his growth. Gongsun Zan, meanwhile, uses politics to give himself a reason to rebel against his former master. Yuan Shao and others had put Liu Yu as a candidate to replace the Emperor, citing his virtues and royal blood. Even though Liu Yu had staunchly refused this, Gongsun Zan made an accusation of treason, and rallied his armies. Now, the White Horse General begins to rampage across Liu Yu's borders, and the initial skirmishes at least go his way. Can Liu Yu's benevolence and political acumen be enough to stop the might of his former officer, now enemy?

Through cunning machinations, your agent finds themselves as undisputed masters of their faction - all as you planned. With none suspecting either their true loyalties nor your own hand in the plot, a final option presents itself. Although it would reveal you as the mastermind, you could have your operative now turn over their lands and assets over to you, giving you full dominance over what was once an independent faction. Or, you could be patient, and have your agent still work on your behalf, in the shadows...
A puppet show is far less fun to watch once the trick has been revealed.
